meanings.definition: The quality of being easily broken or shattered.
meanings.sent1: The frangibility of the glass made it dangerous to handle.
meanings.sent2: The frangibility of the porcelain vase made it a risky choice for a house with kids.
meanings.sent3: The frangibility of the cookie surprised everyone when it crumbled into pieces.
meanings.sent4: The frangibility of trust can be devastating when it shatters like glass.
meanings.sent5: The frangibility of the ice sculpture was evident as it melted under the sun.

meanings.definition: The state of being fragile or delicate.
meanings.sent1: She handled the delicate necklace with care, aware of its frangibility.
meanings.sent2: The frangibility of the butterfly's wings made them easy to damage.
meanings.sent3: The frangibility of the soap bubble made it pop with the slightest touch.
meanings.sent4: The frangibility of a dream can be as fleeting as a delicate soap bubble.
meanings.sent5: The frangibility of the flower petals made them seem like fragile pieces of art.
